010package imagingbook.common.sift.scalespace;
011
012import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Represents a hierarchical Gaussian scale space. See Secs. 25.1.2 and 25.1.4
017 * of [1] for more details.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
021 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/11/20
026 */
027public class GaussianScaleSpace extends HierarchicalScaleSpace {
028
029        public GaussianScaleSpace(FloatProcessor fp, double sigma_s, double sigma_0, int P, int Q, int botLevel, int topLevel) {
030                super(P, Q, sigma_s, sigma_0, botLevel, topLevel);      
031                build(fp);
032        }
033        
034        private final void build(FloatProcessor fp) {
035                double scale_b = getAbsoluteScale(0, -1) ;      // get absolute scale of level(0,-1)
036                double sigma_b = getRelativeScale(sigma_s, scale_b);
037                
038                ScaleLevel Ginit = new ScaleLevel(fp, sigma_s);
039                Ginit.filterGaussian(sigma_b);
040                Ginit.setAbsoluteScale(scale_b);
041
042                // build Gaussian octaves:
043                octaves[0] = new GaussianOctave(0, Q, Ginit, botLevel, topLevel, sigma_0);
044                for (int p = 1; p < P; p++) {
045                        ScaleLevel Gbase = octaves[p-1].getLevel(Q-1).decimate();
046                        octaves[p] = new GaussianOctave(p, Q, Gbase, botLevel, topLevel, sigma_0);
047                }
048        }
049        
050}
